name: Ambrosia Key West Tropical Lodging

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Ambrosia in May and had an awesome experience. The staff was great, accomodations were excellent and the breakfest was delicious. We will definetly stay there again.
reviews.title: We loved it!!

reviews.text: Townhouse was adorable, close to everything, a perfect location for walking or biking everywhere. The staff was great. Great breakfast every morning A wonderful place to stay.We'll certainly be back again.
reviews.title: The perfect place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from another great stay at the Ambrosia! Once again, the staff did everything they could to make our stay enjoyable. The location cannot be beat and the peaceful atmosphere is just what we look forward to every year. I'm so anxious to go back that I can hardly stand it!
reviews.title: Another wonderfull year!

reviews.text: Tropical fantasy from check in to check out! We were given personal check in to our room(which included brief history of house). Amazeing attention to detail in both service & amenities. Our room was georgeous (Havana Cabana) & exceded ecpectations. Landscape was georgeous, especially poolside where they serve breakfast (food was really good too!) We'll never stay anywhere but ambrosia im KW!!
reviews.title: Paradise Found!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent our anniversary at the Ambrosia and couldn't have asked for a better place. The place was gorgeous & conveniently located! We really can't wait to go back!
reviews.title: Can't wait to get back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I liked the inn, but I can't rave about it. The staff is very friendly and helpful, The breakfast was good, scrambled eggs and etc, certainly enough to satisfy you. Our room was supposedly just redone. The bathroom is pretty and modern, but the water pressure is bad.. We had a sitting room, which was rather dark and the couch seemed a bit old. The bed was very confortable. I really felt we overpaid for the room. It just wasn't worth the high price. I will gladly pay for a great room, but this was just average. As far as bikes being delivered, it's a service that goes around delivering bikes to the inns.
reviews.title: Nice inn but overpriced.
Puts the "old" in Olde Key West
reviews.text: The inn is in a good location, I would say if you get a fair price I would recommend it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Noisy, ancient, poorly working AC units help define the stay here. Pool facilities, breakfast and landscaping are excellent. Very helpful hosts !
reviews.title: Great Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Ambrosia for a romantic get away. The service was impecable and the location is fabulous. The room was very clean! I would definitely reccommend this facility.
reviews.title: Best place to stay in KW

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First leg of my trip was with my boyfriend and we stayed in the Treetop 2 pool suite. It was amazing! We had the best time. Very private, romantic and beautiful. The last half of my trip was with my best friend. We stayed in Katie's Cottage. This is a great space for 2-4 people. The two bedrooms are pretty private so would be great for two couples. They have a complimentary FULL breakfast every morning. Very few B and B's offer a full spread in the morning. Tina and Lexie gave us great recommendations on food and they even had our bikes delivered to us at the property so we didn't have to go anywhere. We met some great people that were staying there as well. I could go on and on about this place. I've stayed in lots of places in KW and I will definitely be staying here every time I visit!
reviews.title: Very Friendly, Perfect Location, Great Amenities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were given Ambrosia's name by a Welcome Center and were so very HAPPY with it! Tina greeted us and gave us a wonderful tour of the grounds, explained everything, the breakfast was served from the gazebo, coffee, fruit, breads, eggs, etc, it was a meal! Dog friendly, 2 pools and a jacuzzi! Tina suggested places to eat, where to go for sunset, things we did and enjoyed doing. We will certainly return
reviews.title: So very pleased

reviews.text: second time there, as nice as the first time, ideally located, quiet but close to duval st, wonderful atmosphere around the pool, good value for money. staff friendly and helpful. you can park at the street without paying
reviews.title: wonderful

reviews.text: (breakfast could start at 8.00 instead of 8.30 ) :-)
reviews.title: Good location, nice staff, very good value for money
A beautiful oasis right in the middle of "Old Key West".
reviews.text: looking forward to staying there again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First, I was supposed to stay one night... At the end I stayed four nights. The hotel staff is outstandingly friendly and treats single travellers as well as couples. (Something that is not always the case as one knows if you often travel on your own...). I liked the location: very close to Duval street (busy street), but Amrosia itself is off of the busy road and is a good retriet after a busy day out. The rooms are nice and the whole infrastructure suits what one needs. Is is definately very good value for money. I can only suggest you make there a break.
reviews.title: Great find! We'll definitely come back!

reviews.text: We haven't been to Key West in 15 years. I found Ambrosia from Frommers.com They rate it excellant and it is. We stayed in the Starfish room and enjoyed the pools and breakfast too. The room is beautiful. It's close to Duval and just far enough away to be quiet to sleep at night. Our daughter turned 21 while we were there, so we all had an excellant time. We will be back and we will be staying here again. Our friends will be too. You can park on the street for free too. The breakfast every morning is outstanding. We stayed 3 nights.
reviews.title: Our Daughter's 21st Birthday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent six nights at Ambrosia Key West and loved it! We were first-timers to KW and it was in a great location. Close to almost everything, but still far away enough to be very quiet. We stayed in a pool room and it was very nice, as well as, affordable. We enjoyed that the breakfast included hot options and the pools were also a great place to spend an afternoon. The staff was very helpful and assisted us with restaurant recommendations, coupons for local establishments, and booking excursions. We will definitely be back!
reviews.title: Wonderful Experience for KW First-Timers

reviews.text: The minute I walked through the door with my 11 month old daughter we were greeted warmly and given all the information we needed about anything we wanted to do in Key West. I instantly felt relaxed and comfortable and so did my baby. They were family friendly, pet-friendly and just pure friendly all around. I felt like I've known them for years. We will definetly return to Ambrosia House for our next visit to the keys. Breakfast buffet was always stocked and food was really good. Cranberry lemon muffins, to die for!! Everything about this place was perfect, peaceful and relaxing. :) We loved it! Everything was made alot easier for us by staying here and with an 11 month old baby that was very appreciated. Thanks Ambrosia House, we love u!
reviews.title: Wonderful family friendly place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My fiance and I were doing our yearly trip to Key West . We usually stay at the Casa Marina but couldnt get a room there and found this little great place. We were used to staying at large resorts so wasnt sure if we were going to like a small cottage. We ended up loving it! Its a block or two off Duvall and could walk anywhere. Everyone that stayed there were really nice and it was fun getting to know them. My fiance is in a wheelchair and they do have 1 accessible room which many places like this do not. 2 of the other rooms would have probably been adequate for her also. They even saved the front parking space for us when we arrived. . She was in heaven because it finally gave us a chance to try a B&B/cottage. The grounds are beautiful and it was nice waking up and walking out to the pool area only a few feet away. im not a breakfast eater but i couldnt wait to eat. Its a full breakfast. Bacon,eggs,sausage,sausage gravy and biscuits, fresh fruit,bagles,toast,coffee, and juices. I highty recommend Ambrosia as a place to stay in Key West. We are definiltly returning!
reviews.title: Very accessible and a perfect paradise

reviews.text: Beautiful grounds, alligator room spacious, nice pool,friendly staff. Would like to have had the a/c a little cooler.
reviews.title: Wonderful experience

aka: Ambrosia Key West Tropical Lodging Hotel
description: Luxury, Pet Friendly B&B in the heart of Old Town Key West. The perfect getaway - one block from Duval, 2 blocks from the Historic Seaport - this Bed & Breakfast has 3 pools surrounded by lush gardens and is the ideal place for a relaxing retreat.
